titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Emmet A. Lewis at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 22:27:57 -0500.

change.item: Encoded finding aid started and completed. Madison Chartier

did.abstract: The Lewis, E. mss., 1918-1919, consists of the diary, correspondence, and paybook of Emmet A. Lewis, who fought overseas in World War I.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Emmet A. Lewis is from Indianapolis, Indiana. He served during World War I as part of Company L, 130th Infantry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Lewis, E. mss. consists of the diary, correspondence, and paybook of Emmet A. Lewis, who fought overseas in World War I. His 74-page diary, dated April 1 to November 3, 1918, includes detailed entries about Lewis' training in Kentucky and Tennessee, his time in France, and fighting on the front. Also included are his paybook, 2 postcards, and 2 letters written by him from Luxembourg in 1919.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Lewis, E. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
